conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and interior volume; ceiling/roof is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness, readable room volumes, correct angled viewing, and clean cutaway. Minor simplification at some wall edges/openings reduces geometric rigor slightly.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall macro-layout matches (large living/dining with big window, kitchen adjacent, two bedrooms, central bath). Some secondary partitions/closet shapes and a few wall lengths/openings appear simplified or shifted relative to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (sofa seating, dining table, beds) and bathroom fixtures included; kitchen is present but simplified in cabinet/appliance specificity compared to plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render and readable geometry with good visibility; materials are consistent. Minor softness/occlusion in some interior corners and simplified door geometry reduce interpretability of exact openings.

detected_errors.description: Some interior partition/closet geometry appears simplified or not fully aligned with the 2D plan (secondary wall jogs and storage zones not perfectly preserved).
Door/opening placements and proportions are not fully verifiable/faithful (several doors lack clear swing/frames; some openings appear resized or simplified).
Furniture and built-ins are approximated; kitchen/bath detailing does not fully match the 2D fixture layout.
Rendering is coherent but uses simplified, soft-edged geometry that can mask exact wall/opening boundaries.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout correspondence, but with noticeable simplification/misalignment in secondary partitions and some door/window opening specifics.
